CatDescriptText: Mrs. Olivia Ward, presser at dry cleaners, 902 Anaheim Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 21, 1957, pg. 8 with question: "Do you think the city wage tax, which is one-half of one percent of your wage, is fair or unfair?" answer reads: "I don't think the city wage tax is fair because I have enough taxes to pay, considering my salary."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Olivia Ward wearing dress with jeweled neckline, holding bag and purse, standing in front of brick storefront
